sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be added to each of the numbers \(5 \), \(11 \), \(19 \), and \(27 \) to make them proportional.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "Lets suppose that the required number is $z $.

Since the numbers $5 + z $, $11 + z $, $19 + z $, $27 + z $ are in proportion, we have
\[
	\frac{\input[s1v1]{} + z }{11 + z } = \frac{\input[s1v2]{} + z }{27 + z }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (5 + z )(27 + z ) = (11 + z )(19 + z )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 135 + z (\input[s2v1]{} ) + z ^2 = 209 + z (\input[s2v2]{} ) + z ^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z (32 - 30 ) = 209 - 135 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{209 - 135 }{32 - 30 }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{37 }{1 }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [5, 19], "text": "$$\text{Four numbers are proportional when $a:b::c:d$, thus, using this result we get} \frac{5 + z }{11 + z } = \frac{19 + z }{27 + z }$$"}, {"data": [32, 30], "text": " Upon cross- multiplication and further simplification we get \[
	z = \frac{209 - 135 }{32 - 30 }
\]"}, {"data": [74, 2], "text": "Further simplification will give us the result as \[z= \frac{37 }{1 }\] "}]
